description.narrative: This project involves the development and livelihood rehabilitation phase of E-CARE's work with communities affected by super-typhoon Yolanda. This phase, following the mainly food relief missions undertaken during the first months after the disaster, will involve the continuation of physical rebuilding of houses and securing of land tenure, restoration of farming livelihoods and training on Natural Farming techniques, and engagement in the restoration and development of a range of economic livelihoods. Disaster-Risk Reductions workshops and plans which were It shall be pursued within the E-CARE’s sustainable developmental framework, making use of the Asset-Based Community Development approach as well as the “receivers to givers” policy. The program will also construct a building that will provide: a] offices, b] training center; and c] lodging rooms in view of the projection for a permanent presence of the program in the region.
